body.p:
Stanford Ky. May 24th 1865,
To His Excellency,
Thos E Bramlette.
Govener of Ky.
Govenor.

Your Petitioners beg leave to request that you would remit a fine of $10 -- ^in the latter part of April 1865^ imposed upon Alexander Martin by the town authorities of Stanford Ky -- for alleged breach of the Peace.

We would suggest that your Excellency very properly, and kindly, remitted the fine imposed upon Mr Peyton Douglass -- who was fined in a larger sum, by the same authorities, at the same time. Mr Martin is a civil man -- poor, and has a family to support, and demeans himself properly as a peacable citizen.

Your fellow citizens
J. T. Davis P. M.
D. R. Camden
R. M. White
Thomas. Purdom
Henry T. Harris.
G. A. Lackey
H T Withers
D. W. Vandevar
S H Shanks
W. R. Warnn
B. W. Dunn
W S Bailey
R. Carson
